titleStmt.title: The batchelors delight, being a pleasant new song, shewing the happiness of a single life, and the miseries that do commonly attend matrimony. To the tune of the Kings delight, or, The young mans advice to his fellow batchelors.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. G. on Snow-hil,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication suggested by STC.
Verse: "The world's a blister sweld with care ..."
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
